content: our hello matey today I've got a nice one for you let's go to the table I'll
show you how to make those treasure chests
hey crafters the material were going to use today is this very thin cardboard
you can see the corrugation is very small this sub box I got free at the
post office and then I have another one that I got somewhere else it's the same
type of cardboard essentially it's just that really thin small corrugation
cardboard so now I'm taking a piece and I've marked it and I've got columns and
there are three quarters of an inch long by half an inch wide okay so now you can
see I've marked these up and the reason I did that is because I want to make
boxes out of these I've also marked a sixteenth of an inch mark on the end of
those and I want to do a slant out from each of those because I want to make it
I want to make the box a bit slanted itself so I'll just cut these out now
you can see I just I I've got three actually three boxes on that sheet of
cardboard but I'm just going to cut one out now so I'm just carefully cutting
out the pieces that I'm getting rid of and now I've got the box shape there
with the slants on the end now I'm going to take my boss cutter and just score
these edges I'm not going to cut all the way through this is make it easier to
fold this and you can even use a protractor to help you folded and there
we go we got a nice box shape there and we'll uh put that together but first I
want to do the lid so I've got this cardboard out cut and if you see my
barrel vid DMS craft number 106 you know it you'll see it'll show you how to do
this so now I'm doing measure 3/4 of an inch on this piece and I measure across
and cut it out and this will be my treasure chest lid okay you see how this
nice how it bends like that now I've got another piece of the thin cardboard and
I need to do the edges of the lid so I'm going to use a dime just a regular dime
and measure around it or draw around it actually in a circle I'm just using it
as a blank to draw around and I'm going to measure those in half and
I'll just mark where the halfway point is so I know where to cut so just like a
now I can cut those in half and I'll have half a circle for each side of the
treasure chest lid okay so now I'll cut the rest of those out and I'll be set
okay so here's my treasure chest box and I'm going to put this thing together so
I'm use my small glue gun I don't want too much glue on this one are we really
careful about how much glue you put on there so I'm just going to glue the one
side there and just hold it long enough to hold same with the other one and see
I've got a like a bit of a slant on that which is nice it's not just a straight
up-and-down box okay so now I'll just hold that the other end and it's all set
I've got my box but I do have those extra bits at the top there okay and I
definitely don't want those so I'm going to use my scissors and cut them out now
this is nice because I didn't really have to measure it I can just cut it
afterwards that's why I just left them long like that if I made a mistake it
wouldn't be like ah darn and now I have to do it over so there we go I've got a
nice box there for my treasure chest and now I'm going to do the lid so I've got
this cut piece of cardboard so I'm going to measure six pieces in six corrugation
pieces in and let's cut it off and I can twist it and I'm going to put those on
the ends okay just twist it up get a nice round shape put a little bit of hot
glue on there don't want too much and then just hold it until it sets and it's
all good to go now if you can see this is a little bit a little bit over the
edge too but I can cut that off so here I've got yeah you see that it's coming
over the edge so I'm going to take my scissors and just like the box itself
I'll just cut that excess off okay so that's always nice to have extra than
too little you know I'm saying alright so easy peasy now we have our lid to the
treasure chest now I get the box and pop the lid on there you can see so you got
a nice little chest there and that was super easy to do really really easy okay
so now we've got our pieces we're going to cover up the corrugation with some
white glue the corrugation is so small that if you run the white glue around
the edges it'll cover that up it'll actually fill that corrugation in which
is a really nice thing on this small thin cardboard and then there's some on
the edge I can cover that up so yeah there we go
easy I'll just let it dry okay now I got my piece my bottom in my top now I want
to give this some weight because it's just thin cardboard just essentially
paper so I'm going to squirt a hot glue in there and put a bolt in there or not
I'm sorry I put it nut in there and I'll just glue the lid right on so that's my
closed treasure chest so basic shape there and then I've got another one I
want to do an open one okay so I'm going to do the same thing I'm going to put a
nut in there a nut in there and I'm going to put a little more glue this
time because I want to put treasure in this box so I'm going to I'm going to
glue the lid on with the hot glue at an angle so it looks like it's open and be
all set so we're ready so now I'm going to kind of reinforce that edge with a
little bit of white glue and I'll be ready for the next step
hey crafters I hope you liked the vid make sure you watch part two to finish
up the chest also make sure to give Scottie a lacque if you did like the
video also check out my facebook page links are below
check out my facebook page and forum great folks on there very friendly
community and last but not least go forth and craft
you you
Oh
